intro: Lindernia neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonian lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia in the South Pacific. It belongs to the family Limnanthaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces small, violet to purple flowers that bloom in clusters along the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is considered rare in the wild.
